message.content:
Below is a worked example of how one can reproduce the two “houses” exactly as shown, using only the orientations and colors given in the dictionary images (no rotations other than what is shown in the dictionary).

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE TARGET (MAIN) IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

● There are two separate structures.

■ Left‐Hand House
  – Total of 3 layers:
    1st (bottom) layer:
       – One Yellow cube (left)
       – One Red cube (right)
    2nd (middle) layer:
       – One Green short rectangular “band” spanning both cubes
    3rd (top) layer (the roof):
       – Two Orange wedge blocks meeting at the peak

■ Right‐Hand House
  – Also 3 layers high:
    1st (bottom) layer:
       – Blue cube on the far left
       – Red arch in the middle
       – Green cube on the right
       – Red cube in front of (or just beside) the green cube
    2nd (middle) layer:
       – A long Yellow rectangular bar bridging across the top
         of the blue cube and green cube
    3rd (top) layer:
       – A single Orange wedge set on top as the “roof” piece

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  MATCHING DICTIONARY BLOCKS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Below are the exact dictionary indices required, matching both color and orientation:

● Left‐Hand House
  – Bottom left Yellow cube ⇒ Block #7
  – Bottom right Red cube   ⇒ Block #6
  – Green rectangular band  ⇒ Block #8
  – Left orange roof wedge  ⇒ Block #13
  – Right orange roof wedge ⇒ Block #16

● Right‐Hand House
  – Blue cube   ⇒ Block #4
  – Red arch    ⇒ Block #1
  – Green cube  ⇒ Block #5
  – Red cube    ⇒ Block #6  (re‐used in a second spot)
  – Yellow bar  ⇒ Block #10
  – Orange wedge⇒ Block #12

In total, 11 blocks are used.  Note that the same Red‐cube index (#6) is used in both structures (allowed by the instructions).

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

{"Step1: Move block with index 7",
 "Step2: Move block with index 6",
 "Step3: Move block with index 8",
 "Step4: Move block with index 13",
 "Step5: Move block with index 16",
 "Step6: Move block with index 4",
 "Step7: Move block with index 1",
 "Step8: Move block with index 5",
 "Step9: Move block with index 6",
 "Step10: Move block with index 10",
 "Step11: Move block with index 12"}

A convenient strategy is to build the left‐hand house first (Steps 1–5),
then assemble the right‐hand house (Steps 6–11).
